job_title: HR Administrator in Falls Church, VA
pros: A family environment - dedicated to making the most for their patients and your career.

job_title: Admissions Coordinator in Falls Church, VA
cons: Lack of communication with upper management.

job_title: Accounting/Finance Department in Falls Church, VA
pros:
A lot of good people at the staff level. 
Pay and Benefits were okay
cons:
Management only looking out for themselves--misuse of company funds
Low paid staff expected to own and maintain a snow-worthy vehicle while only being paid $13-$15 per hour

pros: Nice location. Mission is admirable. Some good talent remains
cons: Totally mismanaged. CEO is running too many businesses and is overextended. People are nothing to him unless they make him look good. He had a chance to build something great after former CEO left but he blew it. Hired too many chiefs And over extended the budget - forcing numerous furloughs and layoffs.

review_title: Not a company to work for at this time.  Hope that will change in the future.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Falls Church, VA
pros: Incredibly dedicated clinical staff and rewarding work.
cons: Upper management is disconnected from what really matters - patients, families and employees. They have ruined this organization and lost a lot of really dedicated employees who care about providing quality hospice services. They talk the talk but the bottom line is they have no idea how to support and fairly pay their clinical team members. This organization could be so great but not under the current management.

pros: Hospice work is very rewarding. Coworkers are some of the best I've ever worked with.
cons: Upper management is very out of touch. Staffing does not seem to be a priority.

pros: Good mission. Support staff is caring and hard working
cons: Management is weak. Treat employees as if they were dispensable. So many great team members have left or laid off due to financial problems. Not a stable organization
Company making cuts to programs and employees
